medical_history.chief_complaint: Dyspnea, hypoxemia, and worsening lung disease.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient developed dyspnea progressively over the last 2 years. Symptoms started approximately 3 years prior with herpes zoster infection, followed by episodes of bloody diarrhea diagnosed as inflammatory colitis. During the last 6 months, the dyspnea worsened with numerous exacerbations and a cough with sputum production developed 5 months before admission. Six months prior, he required supplemental oxygen and had transient improvements with prednisone and antibiotics. Three weeks before admission, dyspnea worsened, accompanied by a nonproductive cough and low-grade fever.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Emphysema and inflammatory colitis; COPD diagnosed one year before admission. Hypertension, hyperlipidemia, and depression.
medical_history.family_history: Mother had COPD; children and grandchildren were healthy.
medical_history.social_history: Retired from sales. Smoked for 50 pack-years, stopped 8 months before admission due to dyspnea. Consumed two alcoholic beverages daily. Lived with wife and pets, with no known exposures to pet birds, hay, or asbestos.
